alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Stevens; Todd (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 04 at 2:51PM CDT until April 05 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...CONTINUED LIGHT WINTRY PRECIPITATION WILL RESULT IN SLICK TRAVEL CONDITIONS OVERNIGHT AND INTO WEDNESDAY... .Our first major round of precipitation has ended, with the snow that fell in western Minnesota followed by freezing drizzle resulting in a lack of blowable snow. A wintry mix of snow, sleet, and freezing rain will continue to be present across much of the area tonight and into Wednesday, however we will likely be impacted by a dry slot which will keep accumulations towards the lower end of the expected ranges. Winds are still expected to increase tomorrow and through Thursday, however the threat for blowing snow has diminished and has led to a reduced overall threat. Icy travel conditions are still likely in areas that see freezing drizzle/rain overnight, including during the morning commute tomorrow. The three counties that were in a Winter Storm Warning have been downgraded to a Winter Weather Advisory due to a lack of blowable snow and a reduction in the threat for blowing snow overall. The Advisory has also been trimmed by 6 hours as precipitation largely ends by tomorrow evening. The main threat is now considered the freezing precipitation overnight and the travel impacts through tomorrow morning`s commute. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Douglas, Todd and Stevens Counties. * WHEN...Until 7 PM CDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.
